clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of a Mobile Health Intervention and Health Coach Text Messaging on Cardiovascular Risk of Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Fitness Intensive Therapy (Get FIT) to Promote Healthy Living in Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This study, "Fitness Intensive Therapy (Get FIT) to Promote Healthy Living in Older Adults", will test a mobile-health based intervention which includes use of a Fitbit activity tracker for 3 months, a smartphone application that tracks daily food intake, and one 45 minute counseling session to create personal goals and provide patient education by a health coach; versus Get FIT+ (the same items) plus personalized text messages focusing on participant's activity and nutrition progress as monitored in the app, from the health coach for 3 months. The investigators will measure the impact on participant's diet, physical activity, clinical outcomes, psychosocial well-being, and engagement.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study, "Fitness Intensive Therapy (Get FIT) to Promote Healthy Living in Older Adults", will test 2 behavioral interventions in community-dwelling older adults (age ≥ 60 years) at intermediate and high risk of cardiovascular disease.
1. Get FIT: use of a Fitbit activity tracker, smartphone application to track daily food intake, one 45 minute counseling session to create personal goals and provide patient education by a health coach; vs.
2. Get FIT+: use of a Fitbit activity tracker, smartphone application to track daily food intake, one 45 minute counseling session to create personal goals and provide patient education by a health coach, and personalized push-only text messages from the health coach based on participant's progress as monitored electronically in the application.
Each intervention lasts 3 months, with outcomes measured at baseline, 3 months, and 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline adherence to recommended self-care behaviors at 3 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The Medical Outcomes Study Specific Adherence Scale measures patient adherence to 8 recommended health behaviors (3 items on specific diet/nutrition, 1 item on smoking cessation, 1 item on alcoholic beverages, 1 item on taking prescribed medications, 1 item on regular exercise, 1 item on weight/fluid, 1 item on symptom management). Participants circle the answer that best corresponds to their behavior in the last 4 weeks ("None of the time; 1-A little of the time; 2-Some of the time; 3-A good bit of the time; 4-Most of the time; 5-All of the time"). Scoring is the average of the items for a total specific adherence score.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline diet patterns at 3 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: 3-Day Food Record (ASA24); data from self-recorded diet as entered in smartphone application (My Fitness Pal©)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline physical activity levels at 3 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: data from Fitbit activity tracker as recorded in smartphone application (My Fitness Pal©)

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in HgA1c
secondary_outcome.description: HgA1c as obtained by venous puncture and blood analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Anxiety and Depression symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety and depression symptoms as measured by the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS). Subscale scores of Anxiety (range 0-21; lower scores representing "normal" scores) and Depression (range 0-21; lower scores representing "normal" scores).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in patient activation
secondary_outcome.description: Patient activation as measured by the Patient Activation Measure

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline height in centimeters
secondary_outcome.description: height in centimeters as measured by stadiometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline weight in kilograms
secondary_outcome.description: weight in kilograms as measured by professional beam scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body composition-area
secondary_outcome.description: body composition-area (cm2) as measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body composition-Bone Mineral Content (BMC)
secondary_outcome.description: body composition - BMC (g) as measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body composition-Bone Mineral Density (BMD)
secondary_outcome.description: body composition - BMD (g/cm2) as measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body composition-Fat mass
secondary_outcome.description: body composition - fat mass (g) as measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body composition-Lean mass
secondary_outcome.description: body composition - lean mass (g) as measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body composition-Total Mass
secondary_outcome.description: body composition - total mass (g) as measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body composition-% fat
secondary_outcome.description: body composition - % fat as measured by dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: blood pressure as measured by calibrated aneroid sphygmomanometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in High-Density Lipoproteins (HDL)
secondary_outcome.description: HDL as obtained by venous puncture and blood analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Low-Density Lipoproteins (LDL)
secondary_outcome.description: LDL as obtained by venous puncture and blood analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Triglycerides
secondary_outcome.description: Triglycerides as obtained by venous puncture and blood analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in total cholesterol score
secondary_outcome.description: total cholesterol score as obtained by venous puncture and blood analysis (HDL+LDL+0.2*triglycerides=total)

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: quality of life as measured by the Quality of Life Short Form version 20

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in patterns of use of clinic attendance
secondary_outcome.description: patient patterns of use as measured by clinic attendance

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in patterns of use of mHealth
secondary_outcome.description: patient patterns of use as measured by use of mHealth

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in patterns of use of Retention
secondary_outcome.description: patient patterns of use and engagement as measured by Retention (drop out rate and time of drop out)

secondary_outcome.measure: cost effectiveness
secondary_outcome.description: Cost effectiveness of the intervention as calculated by the sum of costs of training, staff salary, frequency/duration of counseling sessions, follow up visits, real time feedback

arm_group.description: The Get FIT+ intervention, which includes push-only personalized text messages from a health coach.

intervention.description: The Get FIT arm includes use of a free commercially available smartphone application to track daily food intake for 3 months; use of a Fitbit activity tracker for 3 months; and one 45 minute behavioral counseling session to set personal goals and provide education by a health coach.

The Get FIT+ arm includes use of a free commercially available smartphone application to track daily food intake for 3 months; use of a Fitbit activity tracker for 3 months; one 45 minute behavioral counseling session to set personal goals and provide education by a health coach; and personalized text messaging for 3 months by a health coach. The health coach will have access to these participants' daily food and activity data through the smartphone application, and will monitor progress and send push-only text messages to participants in this group based on the participant's goals and progress in the areas of physical activity, nutrition, and weight loss.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged 60 or greater
- at intermediate (10-20%) or high risk (>20%) of developing cardiovascular disease (as measured by Framingham Risk Assessment Tool)
- poor eating behaviors (as measured by Block Fruit/Vegetable/Fiber Screener)
- reduced physical activity (as measured by Block Adult Physical Activity Screener)
Exclusion Criteria:
- cognitive impairment (as measured by Mini-Cog) that impairs ability to understand consent process, surveys, or use of mobile health devices
- chronic drug use
- end stage renal, liver, or pulmonary disease
- current active cancer (i.e., undergoing active treatment for cancer)
- gastrointestinal disease which requires a special diet (e.g. Crohn's, celiac, etc).
